title: ICE caused by failed assertion in on_disk_cache.rs

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

body:
My CI run (`cargo test`) failed spuriously on Windows with the following ICE:

```
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'assertion failed: `(left == right)`
  left: `82`,
 right: `1002111927320821928687967599834759150`', src\librustc\ty\query\on_disk_cache.rs:491:5
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace

error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

note: rustc 1.43.0 (4fb7144ed 2020-04-20) running on x86_64-pc-windows-msvc

note: compiler flags: -C opt-level=1 -C debuginfo=2 -C debug-assertions=on -C incremental -C opt-level=0 --crate-type lib

note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden
```

Unfortunately I've been unable to reproduce the crash, despite no code having changed. As such, I'm not sure if the issue still exists on the latest nightly. 

For reference, the entirety of the crate which failed to compile can be found [here](https://github.com/feather-rs/feather/blob/develop/server/weather/src/lib.rs).
